job_title: International Experiences Student Assistant in Saint Louis, MO
pros:
The people are positive and encourage you to ask questions. 
They provide team lunches occasionally too, which are nice.
I would suggest this company to others.
cons: International Experiences Department can be stressful because so many international students apply.

pros: The people are nice and you can ask for specific courses.
cons: It is one of the lowest-paying adjunct positions out there. MoBap really depends on adjuncts.

job_title: Adjunct Faculty in Saint Louis, MO
cons: Doesn’t pay much but it Is worth doing

pros: The benefits here are wonderful. Working full-time has allowed me to attend college tuition free and make money. They also have great health benefits with which I do not pay any premiums and copays are low.
cons: The downside is that the pay is below par. It’s good they have great benefits or else no one would want to work here. Everyone is nice most of the time but a lot of faculty and staff are extremely judgmental and moody.

job_title: Business Office in Saint Louis, MO
pros:
Great Benefits including Great PTO/Vacation/Sick Time, 403(b)
Have to do something incredibly stupid to get fired, such as stealing.
Laid back atmosphere (sometimes too laid back).
cons:
Average to below average pay.
Hard to promote, have to leave and come back.
Some employees get away with too much because it is too laid back.

review_title: Ok place to get your career started.
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Great perks (time off, 401K, insurance). Team environment. Good place to get started in your career. Laid back. I would recommend this to a friend who is starting their career.
cons: Pay is too little and the employees and management know it. Hard to work your way up.

review_title: Great place to work with awesome environment

cons: None that I can think of.
